page.title: 01Description of Area
page.content: The area we are describing contains most of the town of Caernarfon and a small area of S.W.Anglesey in N.W.Wales.A stretch of the Menai Straits is also included. Caernarfon is the county town of Gwynedd.It is in the centre of the Welsh speaking heartland of Wales. The town is dominated by the castle built by Edward 1st in the 13th Century.The traffic problems in the town have been alleviated when a new fly over was built during the 1970's. The farms in the area are small family run units.The oldest remains in the area are the Celtic settlement at Twtil and the Roman Fort at Segontium. There are two statues on the Maes at Caernarfon one of David Lloyd George and the other is of Syr Hugh Owen.
